document_title: Achilles tendonitis: Causes, symptoms, home treatment
subsection_content:
Some signs and symptoms that may occur when the Achilles tendon is inflamed are:
Burning pain or stiffness in the lower back calf in the morning. In some cases, there may be a partial laceration of the liver or a complete tendon rupture.; Pain in the heel area, especially when stretching the heel or standing on tiptoes. When Achilles tendonitis persists without intervention, the patient is at high risk of rupture of the Achilles tendon.; If a tendon is ruptured, the patient will have persistent pain and swelling in the heel area due to bleeding between the tendons.
